FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The Company&#8217;s revenues decreased approximately $1.3 billion, 20.9 percent, $4.9 billion quarter 2009 period year.&#160;&#160;American&#8217;s passenger revenues decreased 22.3 percent, $1.1 billion, 7.6 percent decrease capacity (available seat mile) (ASM).&#160;&#160;American&#8217;s passenger load factor decreased approximately point 81.8 percent passenger yield decreased 15.4 percent 11.65 cents.&#160;&#160;This resulted decrease passenger revenue seat mile (RASM) 16.0 percent 9.53 cents. (Chautauqua).</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Regional Affiliates&#8217; passenger revenues, based industry standard proration agreements flights connecting American flights, decreased $170 million, 24.9 percent, $513 million result reduction capacity, decreased passenger traffic lower yield.&#160; Regional Affiliates&#8217; traffic decreased 9.1 percent 2.2 billion revenue passenger miles (RPMs), capacity decrease 10.8 percent 2.9 billion ASMs, resulting 1.4 point increase passenger load factor 74.7 percent.&#160;</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Cargo revenues decreased 42.5 percent, $99 million, primarily due decreases advertising mail freight traffic resulting current economic downturn.</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1.8pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Other revenues increased 7.0 percent, $37 million, $565 million due increases passenger service charges.</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br> <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"> <div id="FTR"> <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div> </div> <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always"> <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div> <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"> <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2"> </div> </div> <div id="HDR"> <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div> </div> </div><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps">Operating Expenses</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1.8pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The Company&#8217;s total operating expenses decreased 31.5 percent, $2.4 billion, $5.1 billion quarter 2009 compared quarter 2008.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s operating expenses ASM quarter 2009 decreased 25.7 percent 12.33 cents compared quarter 2008. These decreases largely due impairment charge $1.1 billion write McDonnell Douglas MD-80 Embraer RJ-135 fleets related long-lived assets estimated fair values 2008, decreased fuel prices quarter 2009 compared quarter 2008.&#160;&#160;These decreases offset increased defined benefit pension expenses retiree medical expenses (due stock market decline 2008), cost pressures Company&#8217;s previously announced capacity reductions dependability initiatives.</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; The cases, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Tam Travel et. al., v. Delta Air Lines et. al</font>., United States District Court Northern District California, San Francisco (51 individual agencies), <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Paula Fausky d/b/a Timeless Travel v. TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1.8pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Approximately 52 purported class action lawsuits filed U.S. Company foreign domestic air carriers alleging defendants violated U.S. antitrust laws illegally conspiring set prices surcharges passenger transportation.&#160;&#160;On October 25, 2006, cases, purported class action lawsuits Company named, consolidated United States District Court Northern District California <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">In International Air Transportation Surcharge Antitrust Litigation</font>, Civ. No. 06-1793 (the &#8220;Passenger MDL&#8221;).&#160;&#160;On July 9, 2007, Company named defendant Passenger MDL.&#160;&#160;On August 25, 2008, plaintiffs dismissed claims Company action.&#160;&#160;On March 13, 2008, March 14, 2008, additional purported class action complaints, Turner v. American Airlines, al., Civ. No. 08-1444 (N.D. Cal.), LaFlamme v. American Airlines, al., Civ. No. 08-1079 (E.D.N.Y.), filed Company, alleging Company violated U.S. antitrust laws illegally conspiring set prices surcharges passenger transportation European countries, respectively.&#160;&#160;The Turner plaintiffs failed perfect service Company, unclear intend pursue claims.&#160; On February 17, 2009, LaFlamme plaintiffs agreed dismiss claims Company prejudice.&#160; In event Turner plaintiffs pursue claims LaFlamme plaintiffs re-file claims Company, Company vigorously defend lawsuits, adverse judgment actions material adverse impact Company.</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1.8pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On August 21, 2006, patent infringement lawsuit filed American American Beacon Advisors, Inc. (then wholly-owned subsidiary Company) United States District Court Eastern District Texas (<font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Ronald A. Katz Technology Licensing, L.P. v. American Airlines, Inc., al.</font>).&#160;&#160;This case consolidated Central District California pre-trial purposes numerous cases brought plaintiff defendants.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;The plaintiff alleges American infringes number plaintiff&#8217;s patents, relates automated telephone call processing systems.&#160;&#160;The plaintiff seeking past future royalties, injunctive relief, costs attorneys' fees.&#160;&#160;On December 1, 2008, court dismissed prejudice claims American Beacon.&#160;&#160;On May 22, 2009, granting summary judgment American based invalidity non-infringement, court dismissed claims American.&#160;&#160;Plaintiff filed notice appeal June 22, 2009 respect court&#8217;s ruling American.&#160;&#160;Although Company believes plaintiff&#8217;s claims merit vigorously defending lawsuit, final adverse court decision awarding substantial money damages placing material restrictions existing automated telephone call system operations material adverse impact Company.</font></div><br> <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Purpose, Definitions.</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The purpose AMR Corporation 2009 Long Term Incentive Plan (the &#8220;Plan&#8221;) enable AMR Corporation (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) attract, retain reward key employees Company Subsidiaries, strengthen mutuality interests key employees Company&#8217;s stockholders, offering key employees performance-based stock incentives and/or equity interests equity-based incentives Company, performance-based incentives payable cash.</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">For purposes Plan, terms defined set below:</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div> <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(a)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#8220;Award&#8221; means award Stock Option, Stock Appreciation Right, Restricted Stock, Deferred Stock, Performance Related Award Stock Based Award made pursuant Plan.&#160;&#160;Award include cash incentive award payable accordance Section 8(b).</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div> <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; (ii)&#160;a Subsidiary; (iii)&#160;a division unit foregoing based comparative performance foregoing relative past performance companies: (A)&#160;return equity; (B) total shareholder return; (C) primary fully diluted earnings share; (D) EBITDA; (E) revenues; (F)&#160;cash flows, revenues and/or earnings relative parameters (e.g., net gross assets); (G)&#160;operating income; (H)&#160;return investment; (I)&#160;changes Stock; (J)&#160;return assets; (K) operational performance (including on-time performance); (L) customer satisfaction; (M) employee surveys (the &#8220;Performance Criteria&#8221;).&#160;&#160;In addition performance conditions established pursuant immediately preceding sentence, Committee condition vesting Performance Related Award achieving additional performance conditions nature Committee deems appropriate.&#160;&#160;Excluding Stock Options and/or Stock Appreciation Rights granted hereunder, maximum number shares Stock subject Performance Related Stock Award granted key employee calendar year exceed 750,000 shares, number adjusted pursuant Section&#160;3(c); provided that, based level achievement performance objectives, number shares Stock issuable respect Performance Related Stock Award achievement applicable performance conditions number shares initially granted.&#160;&#160;The maximum initial dollar Performance Related Incentive Award granted key employee exceed $3,000,000;
